data.what_is:
GetResponse Marketing Automation is a platform designed to maximize revenue growth. With over 25 years of proven expertise, GetResponse empowers marketing and communications professionals to drive results through timely, targeted email, SMS, and web push campaigns.

With GetResponse Marketing Automation, you get comprehensive AI-powered email marketing software that's easy to use and ensures your messages reach the right audience at the right time. You're supported by proven deliverability, high-volume infrastructure, and intuitive tools that enable you to create engaging and personalized email campaigns. But it doesn't stop there. GetResponse Marketing Automation goes beyond email marketing by offering a scalable and visual marketing automation solution. Convert anonymous visitors into loyal customers by mapping out and automating their ideal customer journey.

Reach your audience across multiple channels with native SMS capabilities, webinars to engage and educate, web push notifications for real-time updates, and customizable landing pages, popups and forms to capture leads effectively. With tailored and dedicated support from day one, GetResponse Marketing Automation ensures your success. From effective onboarding to ongoing strategic guidance and campaign management, our team is committed to helping you achieve your goals.

Join the thousands of businesses already optimizing their growth and customer engagement with GetResponse MAX. Experience the power of AI-driven content and recommendations, flexible pricing options, and industry-leading support. GetResponse MAX is your solution for driving revenue growth through advanced email marketing and marketing automation.
data.positioning_against_competitor: GetResponse Marketing Automation is an easy-to-use tool. Our visual builder makes it easy to map the scenarios.Our integrated AI generation tools help users save time and create better emails more quickly.There is 24/7, tailored support.Our marketing automation software comes with multi-channel communication tools (SMS, webinars, web push, Live Chats) that can be executed with a visual marketing automation tool .GetResponse Marketing automation customers increase customer engagement and loyalty along with driving lead generation and growing their customer list.Seller DetailsSellerGetResponseCompany Websitewww.getresponse.comYear Founded1998HQ LocationPolandTwitter@getresponse57,818 Twitter followersLinkedIn(r) Pagewww.linkedin.com487 employees on LinkedIn(r)DescriptionGetResponse is a comprehensive marketing software platform that helps you create content, boost sales, and increase traffic to your business online. Integrated email marketing, autoresponders, and landing pages let you automate essential tasks and launch effective marketing campaigns. Advanced analytics make it easy to track conversions, leads, and ROI, and learn what your customers want. Customizable template scenarios do the heavy lifting for you -- no coding necessary.JROverview Provided by:Jack Ramsay
data.supported_languages: German, English, French, Indonesian, Italian, Dutch, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Vietnamese

pricing_plans.plan_description: Solution for demanding users looking for advanced marketing features and reliable support.
All-inclusive solution with dedicated Customer Experience Manager (CEM) and infrastructure.
Marketing tools for ecommerce to promote products and grow sales.
Designed to scale growth through automated, personalized marketing.
Perfect for growing online presence, converting leads, and nurturing campaigns.
A suite of free tools to grow a contact list and send emails.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file. This feature was mentioned in 65 GetResponse MAX reviews.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 69 GetResponse MAX reviews. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product. This feature was mentioned in 56 GetResponse MAX reviews.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements 74 reviewers of GetResponse MAX have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action. This feature was mentioned in 66 GetResponse MAX reviews.

features.content: Based on 76 GetResponse MAX reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies. 53 reviewers of GetResponse MAX have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.  47 reviewers of GetResponse MAX have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 74 GetResponse MAX reviews. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

initial_reviews.review_title: Reliable platform with great support
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
Our company has been using GetResponse MAX for almost 5 years now both by the marketing team for customer newsletters and by the PR team for press releases. Although the latter might not be the intended use-case, it has served us well for both. The drag-and-drop editor and list management are easy to get into even for colleagues who haven't worked with GetResponse before and don't know HTML to code their own emails, while the list management and automated mailings in particular allow for some powerful features like sending specific emails to specific customers based on any relevant critera. You have to dig a bit deeper to fully grasp those more advanced features as they are not always as intuitive as the more surface-level features, but once you get the hang of it, I've yet to find a workflow I couldn't realise.
In those 5 years, we had only one major problem where our emails weren't delivered to a larger number of recipients, but their support team was quick to respond and fix this issue, so I won't hold that against them.
Note that the MAX platform includes many more features like embeddable chats, automated SMS replies, Webinars, and more. We haven't used those either because they don't make sense for our business or we simpy didn't have the chance to try them yet, which is why I can comment only on the core features around mailings. Those, as outlined above, work great however, and I can highly recommend GetResponse for them.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Honestly, besides the aforementioned deliverability problem that was quickly resolved, I've only ever found small nitpicks here and there. Things like for example not being able to set a default color for newly inserted buttons in the drag-and-drop editor, or some features being buried maybe one submenu too deep, making them not obvious and requiring a look into the documentation (which is fine, but could sometimes be a bit more in-depth), or moving to a different place after a redesign of the backend. None of that is a dealbreaker, though, and even here I've found our account managers to be quite responsive to feedback. The biggest letdown are probably A/B tests which wolrk fine, but are limited in their reportings and in their setup.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
As mentioned before, we use it mainly for customer newsletters and press releases. We have a really engaged audience of subscribers, and GetResponse lets us create nice-looking emails, delivers them reliably, and - important for us as a European company - gives us all the tools to make sure we're GDPR compliant.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, no learning curve.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
We use it primarily for email marketing - our newsletter communication, and so far it's been super intuitive and straightforward. Allows us to design and adjust our designs as we go which is helpful based on how frequently we use the software. Various gif options to include, loads well and the preview option helps you see how the messages look in dark/light modes, on mobiles. I personally love the 'perfect timing' option which allows you to send the message at the most convenient time based on their past behaviour and their timezone. Customer support is always helpful and fast, which is a huge plus!

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
I would love to see more in-depth and customizable options for reporting whether for growth or email data, and for it to look a bit prettier.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to communicate with our loyal customer base regarding our updates, offers & promotions, our company and highlights. Keeps us connected and serves as a means of communication with those who are already aware of our company.

initial_reviews.review_title: Marketing Excellence with GetResponse MAX
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
As I celebrate my five-year journey with GetResponse MAX, I can't help but marvel at the transformative impact it has had on my marketing endeavors. This platform isn't just a tool - it's been a steadfast companion, empowering me to achieve unparalleled success in the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing.

From day one, GetResponse MAX impressed me with its robust suite of features, intuitive interface, and unwavering reliability. Whether crafting intricate automation workflows, designing captivating email campaigns, or analyzing detailed performance metrics, GetResponse MAX has consistently exceeded my expectations.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
One small thing I would improve is to give us the ability to send Push Notifications easily through the app or mobile interface.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Great deliverability, easy automation setup and unparalleled level of support provided by the GetResponse team.

We send over 10 million emails a month on this tool in these 8 years and our deliverability has continued to be great.

Great deliverability and an easy automation setup.

initial_reviews.review_title: Highly Recommend GetResponse to Generate Leads and Organize our Communication and Marketing Strategy
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
We've been implementing GetResponse Max since 2020 and have deployed it in nearly 65 offices worldwide to strengthen our communication and optimize our sales performance. We chose GetResponse MAX because the interface is translated into many languages. GetReponse is very easy to use, with an optimized UI. GetResponse provide centralized access for multiple accounts and users. And finally, we use API integration for synchronizing contacts and data with our ERP system.

And, last but not least, the customer support is really great. Our dedicated Product Support Expert knows very well the product but also our needs so that they respond to our requests without delay and very often within the hour.

They also take into account any bugs we may report and fix them.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The global contact search engine sometimes lacks precision but we can find another way to find it and the segment creation engine is very powerful but sometimes difficult to use.
There too many features available and even if we don't use all the numerous functions for capturing leads and launching multi-channel communication campaigns, we know we can rely on when we will be ready to use it.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
GetResponse enables us to ensure maximum deliverability of our campaigns and it helps us to acquire an excellent reputation. It helps us to synchronize with available APIs our data and contact with our ERP system very easily and quickly

initial_reviews.review_title: A comprehensive and user-friendly marketing tool to start with
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
What I appreciate most about GetResponse MAX is its comprehensive set of features, encompassing email marketing, automation, and landing pages. The platform's versatility seamlessly integrates various aspects of digital marketing efforts. The user-friendly interface and robust reporting section enhance its value, making campaign optimization a breeze. The centralized solution for multiple marketing needs is a significant advantage. Furthermore, the very efficient customer service and the ease of implementation contribute to the overall positive experience, ensuring that support is readily available and the onboarding process is smooth.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The platform's automation capabilities are somewhat restrictive, lacking flexibility for certain use cases. The absence of a winning path feature hinders effective A/B testing, making campaign optimization less straightforward. The lack of reporting on workflows is a notable gap, impacting the ability to assess performance effectively.
Dealing with API rate limits for large data volumes is inconvenient, with data pushes taking an extended time. Beyond a certain database size, GetResponse MAX faces scalability challenges, limiting its suitability for rapidly growing databases. While the platform performs well up to a certain scale, these limitations may pose challenges for businesses with specific automation, testing, reporting, scalability, and integration needs.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform allows multiple users to have their separate access and accounts. This individualized access enhances collaboration while maintaining independence, addressing the challenge of shared access complexities.
GetResponse MAX provides an easy-to-use email marketing platform. Its user-friendly interface simplifies the process, allowing team members the freedom to work autonomously on their campaigns without the need for extensive training or coding knowledge.
The platform's easy onboarding process ensures a smooth transition. Team members can quickly grasp the functionalities, reducing the learning curve and enabling them to get started on their marketing initiatives promptly.
GetResponse MAX empowers users to activate their 1st party data effectively. This capability enhances data-driven marketing strategies, enabling more targeted and personalized campaigns.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
GetResponse is a well-designed and intuitive tool, ideal for creating customized newsletter campaigns that drive sales. It offers a wide range of personalization options, the ability to design marketing automation sequences, and features a very convenient editor for creating your own email templates. We've been using it for nearly 6 years, and during this time, it has improved significantly. The customer care service is truly helpful and dedicated to their work.

It makes email marketing easier, and it helps create campaigns that drive sales.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
Our company has been using GetResponse MAX for almost 5 years now both by the marketing team for customer newsletters and by the PR team for press releases. Although the latter might not be the intended use-case, it has served us well for both. The drag-and-drop editor and list management are easy to get into even for colleagues who haven't worked with GetResponse before and don't know HTML to code their own emails, while the list management and automated mailings in particular allow for some powerful features like sending specific emails to specific customers based on any relevant critera. You have to dig a bit deeper to fully grasp those more advanced features as they are not always as intuitive as the more surface-level features, but once you get the hang of it, I've yet to find a workflow I couldn't realise.
In those 5 years, we had only one major problem where our emails weren't delivered to a larger number of recipients, but their support team was quick to respond and fix this issue, so I won't hold that against them.
Note that the MAX platform includes many more features like embeddable chats, automated SMS replies, Webinars, and more. We haven't used those either because they don't make sense for our business or we simpy didn't have the chance to try them yet, which is why I can comment only on the core features around mailings. Those, as outlined above, work great however, and I can highly recommend GetResponse for them.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Honestly, besides the aforementioned deliverability problem that was quickly resolved, I've only ever found small nitpicks here and there. Things like for example not being able to set a default color for newly inserted buttons in the drag-and-drop editor, or some features being buried maybe one submenu too deep, making them not obvious and requiring a look into the documentation (which is fine, but could sometimes be a bit more in-depth), or moving to a different place after a redesign of the backend. None of that is a dealbreaker, though, and even here I've found our account managers to be quite responsive to feedback. The biggest letdown are probably A/B tests which wolrk fine, but are limited in their reportings and in their setup.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
As mentioned before, we use it mainly for customer newsletters and press releases. We have a really engaged audience of subscribers, and GetResponse lets us create nice-looking emails, delivers them reliably, and - important for us as a European company - gives us all the tools to make sure we're GDPR compliant.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, no learning curve.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
We use it primarily for email marketing - our newsletter communication, and so far it's been super intuitive and straightforward. Allows us to design and adjust our designs as we go which is helpful based on how frequently we use the software. Various gif options to include, loads well and the preview option helps you see how the messages look in dark/light modes, on mobiles. I personally love the 'perfect timing' option which allows you to send the message at the most convenient time based on their past behaviour and their timezone. Customer support is always helpful and fast, which is a huge plus!

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
I would love to see more in-depth and customizable options for reporting whether for growth or email data, and for it to look a bit prettier.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to communicate with our loyal customer base regarding our updates, offers & promotions, our company and highlights. Keeps us connected and serves as a means of communication with those who are already aware of our company.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
We've been implementing GetResponse Max since 2020 and have deployed it in nearly 65 offices worldwide to strengthen our communication and optimize our sales performance. We chose GetResponse MAX because the interface is translated into many languages. GetReponse is very easy to use, with an optimized UI. GetResponse provide centralized access for multiple accounts and users. And finally, we use API integration for synchronizing contacts and data with our ERP system.

And, last but not least, the customer support is really great. Our dedicated Product Support Expert knows very well the product but also our needs so that they respond to our requests without delay and very often within the hour.

They also take into account any bugs we may report and fix them.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The global contact search engine sometimes lacks precision but we can find another way to find it and the segment creation engine is very powerful but sometimes difficult to use.
There too many features available and even if we don't use all the numerous functions for capturing leads and launching multi-channel communication campaigns, we know we can rely on when we will be ready to use it.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
GetResponse enables us to ensure maximum deliverability of our campaigns and it helps us to acquire an excellent reputation. It helps us to synchronize with available APIs our data and contact with our ERP system very easily and quickly

all_reviews.review_title: A comprehensive and user-friendly marketing tool to start with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
What I appreciate most about GetResponse MAX is its comprehensive set of features, encompassing email marketing, automation, and landing pages. The platform's versatility seamlessly integrates various aspects of digital marketing efforts. The user-friendly interface and robust reporting section enhance its value, making campaign optimization a breeze. The centralized solution for multiple marketing needs is a significant advantage. Furthermore, the very efficient customer service and the ease of implementation contribute to the overall positive experience, ensuring that support is readily available and the onboarding process is smooth.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The platform's automation capabilities are somewhat restrictive, lacking flexibility for certain use cases. The absence of a winning path feature hinders effective A/B testing, making campaign optimization less straightforward. The lack of reporting on workflows is a notable gap, impacting the ability to assess performance effectively.
Dealing with API rate limits for large data volumes is inconvenient, with data pushes taking an extended time. Beyond a certain database size, GetResponse MAX faces scalability challenges, limiting its suitability for rapidly growing databases. While the platform performs well up to a certain scale, these limitations may pose challenges for businesses with specific automation, testing, reporting, scalability, and integration needs.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform allows multiple users to have their separate access and accounts. This individualized access enhances collaboration while maintaining independence, addressing the challenge of shared access complexities.
GetResponse MAX provides an easy-to-use email marketing platform. Its user-friendly interface simplifies the process, allowing team members the freedom to work autonomously on their campaigns without the need for extensive training or coding knowledge.
The platform's easy onboarding process ensures a smooth transition. Team members can quickly grasp the functionalities, reducing the learning curve and enabling them to get started on their marketing initiatives promptly.
GetResponse MAX empowers users to activate their 1st party data effectively. This capability enhances data-driven marketing strategies, enabling more targeted and personalized campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Good potential but awful mailing list support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
Get Response does some things well:
- Easy landing page design
- Easy email design
The design is really easy but some functionalities are hidden and you have to contact support to let you know where they are.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
-Contacts import from your previous email management tool is really challenging, almost impossible. If you have more than 50 contacts in your database it will take you ages to import. If one of your contact is blocked at GetResponse backend level (for example a different company sent an email and the person decided to unsubscribe that person will be blocked at the system level). I have a secondary list that I exported from mailchimp. All valid emails. GetResponse is blocking my import because some people in my list are blocked by them.
So the right things to do is to tell you which emails are bad. But no Get Response will not share with you this information. So I have to upload one by one my contact. I have 300 contacts so I will do it manually. Get response has a limit of 50 daily contacts even on the paid plans. So it will take me 6 days to upload my list.
Get Response does not provide me with any flexibility AT ALL.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Right now Get Response is causing more headaches than solving any solutions. Normally you use a marketing automation tool to simplify your life. With Get Response it is the opposite, at least for me.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The landing page builder has its issues - must double-check the mobile version and adjust - a little harder to build a conversion-ready page. I am loving the new website builder, the main drawback is no real blog. It takes a little while to get familiar with the click on side of page name to change that page.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
It is easy to pick up. There is info in GR University to learn more about email marketing/funnels.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
It runs my autoresponder series, and I love that it lets me know who is not opening emails, so we remove them. The API joins to my Hustle subscription app. I also use it as a basic CRM because of the Notes section there and can see when they signed up, and what emails they opened and clicked. The reports area is also useful.

all_reviews.review_title: Worst experience with a software vendor I've had in my life
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The interface is easy to use, and it works pretty quickly.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
- Deliverability is the worst of the market.

- Support takes days to answer, and sometimes only if you insist several times.

- They deleted your database contacts, saying that those addresses didn't exist, and I had to prove to them that they did. I can only imagine how many contacts they deleted without me noticing.

- If you export your contacts and you have a decent size list, you'll miss several. I missed about 2000 contacts.

- Automations fail. Sometimes they are sent to every list instead of the lists you have specified.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. I've lost several thousands of dollars due to their extremely low deliverability. The worst part is when I told them, it not only took weeks for them to reply, but when they finally did it, they denied it even though I had dozens of users telling me they weren't receiving my emails.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
GR is continually developing new features and tools. When we started with the basic GR subscription a few years ago, it was a pretty bare-bones marketing email client. Since then, they have put a lot of effort into improving not only the email deployment module but have added many other features like marketing automation, forms, landing pages, and lead funnels. Recently we have upgraded to GR MAX, and this has helped us immensely with the APIs and integrations, really taking our marketing to the next level. The scalable subscriptions and fair pricing make GR a great option, especially for SMBs.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
GR can be slow with customer service since they are based in the EU (we are in North America), but their help docs are really good for troubleshooting, and we have an account success manager who has been very responsive. The UX is still a little clunky as they continually add new features, but they seem to be constantly improving and streamlining it for the better. The analytics modules need to be better for comparing multiple emails and A/B testing.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can better contact our customers via email and educate them on our products and updates. Building out a newsletter and subscription list has helped immensely with email engagement. Syncing our CRM contacts with GR has allowed us to automate some conversations for different customers and prospects in the pipeline.

I appreciate the consistent CAN-SPAM compliance monitoring as well as the regular check ins with my rep to ensure we are staying compliant.

My rep has been exceptional and I have had the same CSR since 2017 which is a rarity with any platform.

all_reviews.review_title: I was IN LOVE with GR - Until my lists kept getting rejected & my deliverability suddenly dropped.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I originally picked this program based on a variety of capabilities it seemed to possess that no other program seemed to match. I spent months trialing many before finally deciding on GetResponse. The templates were beautiful, extremely customizable with ease to our brand, the workflow capabilities were strong, the live 24-7 chat support was a huge bonus, and they had the ability to add pop-up sign up forms, and landing pages to our website.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
After about 3 months of using this program with no issues whatsoever and being so thrilled with it, problems started to happen as my lists grew. All the sudden, lists were constantly being rejected. Even when I used an integration service to extract bounced emails, they were accepted but sometimes my deliverability suffered. I checked with multiple list cleaning services and showed there were hardly any invalid emails, and I had NO problem importing these same contacts directly into mailchimp. Furthermore, these were valid emails as many were obtained directly from our CEO through his network of contacts, and others from our app's list of active, registered users. There was NO excuse for these list rejects and deliverability issues when there were no problems the first 3 months, and yet after multiple attempts to advise support of my claims and screenshots and points they provided no help or solutions and simply but they just sent me the same pasted article response which basically pinned it back on me to clean up my lists (which other providers approved). It doesn't matter how many bells and whistles you have, if you can't even import a list or get your email seen, what's the point?

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
Do not use this program!!! You are setting yourself up for disappointment. I cannot tell you how excited I was to start using this program, it seemed like it had everything I needed and was so easy to use. Until it no longer worked! The support was very insincere whenever I reached out multiple times to try and rectify the issues I was having. And also, another interesting note, back when I started, I used the live chat a lot whenever I had questions. I used to always get the same kind people over and over. Back when I started having these problems and would write in, all the support staff were different people and they were not as knowledgeable, friendly or helpful. Coincidence?! I attempted multiple times to contact different members of their team and let them know the issues I was having but they just sent me the same pasted article response! It doesn't matter how many bells and whistles you have, if you can't even import a list or get your email seen, what's the point?

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am not able to solve any problems anymore with GetResponse because my lists are getting rejected and my deliverability is low (less than 1%).

all_reviews.review_title: Got no response at Get Response
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The on boarding is excellent.  To me it was light years ahead of the competition.  The highly visual style of everything and the overall look and feel are comforting.  It is relatively easy to understand.  Liked that they had a school but it gets bogged down in too much detail.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
While they have tech support they are quickly dismissive.  I had a problem with the security of my site and people getting warning alerts when landing on my page.  All they would say is "not happening on our end".  Consequently I drove a lot of traffic to a dysfunctional site and got no conversions and they couldn't help me so what's the point?  I think the most egregious thing as a newbie is that while they brought my domain name over they did not bring my email.  So here I was thinking my email worked and it didn't.  The support people just seem to want to move on as quickly as possible they are not really concerned about you like they are at AWeber.  They should really consider a concierge service to help people get off the ground.  If we fail, they fail too, but if we succeed you have a customer for life.  Next stop for me is Force24 which offers whit glove service but at a price.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
Use the autoresponder only, test, test, test.  Don't expect much from tech support and don't expect details on what your traffic is doing on your site if you use their landing page builder.  I think it's a step above Mailchimp in UI/ UX but I think you really have to cut your teeth on something like Mailchimp before you can graduate to GetResponse.  I really wanted to like Get Response but they are too corporate and have too many rules and still not enough guidance.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was trying to make a simple bridge page to get started in affiliate marketing.  My experience was overwhelming I felt discouraged and disappointed.  It was hard to get grainukarbreporting I had no idea how long or where people were on my sorry landing page and of course if they wanted to email me they couldn't and I am sure my outgoing auto response never worked.

I really appreciate that there is no bugs at all. Everything works like it is supposed to work. The automations have a nice lay-out with a very clear logic.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
It's not possible to update contacts , so every time we start a new campaign, we have to create a new list that creates numerous duplicates. It's quite complicated to keep the database clean because of that.

Try to keep it simple, as with GetResponse things can become bulky. Try to take care of your database early and clean up the lists that you do not need. all_reviews.review_title: Our Account Manger is amazing - his response time is impeccable!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
Definitely the attention that we receive from our Account Manager. Also the ease of use within the platform itself. The automation workflows are easy to set-up and it's great that you are able to clone automations, so that you aren't always starting from scratch.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
I would like to see some more in depth reporting options and metrics. I would also like to see a more developed email design tool that makes designing much easier for those who may not be experts in coding.

Another helpful feature would be in depth deliverability resources for making sure IP/Domain reputations remain strong and emails reach the inbox.

Heat mapping would be another great feature to be able to detect where in the email our subscribers are interacting most.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
This is a great tool for companies that have newsletter sends as well as the need for automation. The account management is top notch and you will have the support you need. Highly recommend!

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to reach our audience based on engagement level. This allows us to send more content to subscribers who want to interact. We can then scale back based on lower engaged subscribers. This allows us to monetize those users who are interacting with our content. We can also use them to test new content before launching. Another benefit is the ability to segment the highly engaged users for IP warm-up purposes.

We are also able to many advanced things with API integration to make my job much easier. For example we can auto post our daily newsletter email straight from our API so that I don't have to go in and individually code every email for each day.

all_reviews.review_title: [SCAM] I paid $7k for a 2 year plan, they rejected my list and now won't refund my money!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I have been using Getresponse & Mailchimp to manage my marketing for 2 separate businesses.  I like GetResponses UI much better than Mailchimps.  Getresponse is much easier to get setup and navigate.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
After spending hours getting everything moved over to Getresponse from Mailchimp, I tried uploading my subscriber list of 90,000+ subscribers to GetResponse and had my list rejected!

I also paid and upgraded to the 2-year basic plan and was billed over $7,000!

I even went back and scrubbed my list and tried uploading 50,000 subscribers, but it was still rejected!

Now I asked GetResponse for a refund of my $7k I paid but they said they can't do it because that is their policy!!! SCAM!

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Getresponse usually helps manage my email subscriptions and automate my drip campaigns...but they won't accept my list :(

One of the advantages of the tool is the ability to produce informative material that is quite attractive to customers, it also has an efficient and effective flow of information. Through it you can recruit potential clients that are key to the success of your company. It is also a very light and comfortable tool to use, which makes its adaptation easy and productive.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
One of the concerns that I have about the software is that it should improve in the part of the contact records, simplify the registry and implement a function that allows them to be added automatically and avoid being made manual, and thus ensure that the process is not tedious and slow.

It is a tool that most of its functions are quite relevant and fundamental for the work performance of an organization, which is why it would be ideal to implement it to speed up search processes for potential clients in the world of marketing and in turn Maintain an excellent flow of information that allows you to efficiently and productively transmit all types of information that you want to send concerning product promotions and offers.

We started using GetResponse in the marketing department of our company because it is a tool that allows us to keep the client informed about our offers of products and services by email, and in turn find new customers. It is a very useful tool that has also allowed us to locate the most potential clients that we find in marketing events, and through the tool we can get in touch with them directly. Not only do we use the tool to inform customers of our offers and promotions, we also use it to send all kinds of relevant information that we want to convey to our customers, through a range of templates that allow us to produce fairly dynamic and responsive material.

all_reviews.review_content:

The best thing about get response is the level of automation it shows, which has been very productive for us. The amount of templates that it offers saves you a lot of time in the design of the emails, boosting your efficiency by reducing a big headache and thus you will have more time to dedicate yourself to something else.

Complementing the level of automation is the price that already this great feature would not be very functional without a good price. Hey response offers you a generous amount of emails for a very acceptable price, further improving its value.

But the cherry on the cake is definitely the commitment to the customer that our get response. The fact of calling you to solve any inconvenience or clarify any doubt instead of sending you to an email or technical support page gives a pliss to the relationship that proves the commitment they have as a company.

The aspect that I think should be worked on in future updates is the interface.

The interface of get response is not the most user friendly, it has a somewhat old appearance and sometimes a bit complicated to understand. The truth should be simpler, more modern and easier to manipulate, showing the results in a very visual way and easy to digest without many complications since this negatively affects the general experience.

Highly recommended since it will help you better manage your time. The truth is that such a tool is appreciated and when you contrast it with your price you realize that it is a very competitive option in the market. As if that were not enough, it shows you the commitment that you have, maintaining a very closed and friendly communication. Highly recommended

The big problem that get response has helped us solve is the issue of time consumption based on productivity. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The account reps at Get Response are a great touch and a surprise in the world of digital marketing tools. It's pretty rare to get a phone call from any of the marketing software companies we contract with and Get Response has touched base several times. That's impressive and a nice "old school" touch that I appreciate.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The biggest failure of Get Response is a platform that isn't as user-friendly as some of its competitors. In terms of functionality, it seems to do everything we need it to do, it's dashboard and campaign builder tools are just not as pretty in many cases.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
If you have the ability to code at all yourself, we highly recommend Get Response. It offers all of the functionality we need at a price that's more reasonable than many of the others out there.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Get Response for drip campaigns, weekly sale newsletters and have experimented with landing pages.

Get Response has been solid for our weekly newsletter list and managing direct call to action type emails to drive revenue to our customer list.

all_reviews.review_title: Perfect for mid-sized businesses & outstanding customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The customer support is by far the best I've received for a marketing SAAS product. I fire off a lot of questions to my account manager and nothing is too much trouble and the response time is good. They've really helped us refine our automation over the past year.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
While it may lack the feature-rich triggers and the detailed workflows of a Marketo or Pardot, for a medium-sized business, with a product like ours, it's more than enough to get the job done. The biggest dislike is the unique ID per customer, per campaign (as opposed to a unique ID based on email) - which makes funnel management a little more challenging. But GR have been helpful in solving this issue for us.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Through refining our campaign structure and workflows, we've been able to add additional lead flows and the platform has been able to handle our sizable increase in volume over the past 6 months.

all_reviews.review_title: It is a good tool for inbound marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
It is one of the few tools that is designed for inbound marketing, has many functions such as custom landing pages, A/B tests, design tests and sending videos by email. It has a unique landing page editor with various options, as well as integration with analytical tools and segmentation functions.
It also allows to automate lists and pass subscribers from one list to another depending on the criteria we choose. In general you have many customization options.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The weak point of GetResponse is its ability to deliver as they need to improve a lot. On the other hand, even though your landing page editor offers many options, your templates look outdated and antiquated, this is another point they need to improve.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
It is a great tool to be in contact with our customers in an efficient way. Its functions allow you to customize everything quickly which is important to maintain productivity. And it allows you to add administrators to facilitate the work with your collaborators.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
GetResponse has allowed me to manage my customer lists in a comfortable and efficient way thanks to its segmentation options allowing me to group them by country, or by the purchases they have made for example. Their automation options and flexible forms have allowed me to save a lot of time that I can focus on other tasks.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The visual campaign builder is probably my most used and favorite part of the platform. For the price, the builder is exceptional. It has capabilities that are close to the level of much higher priced products.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
In the past, I felt the weaker area of GetResponse was the CRM.  However, I see that they are doing some major updates in this area of the platform. It will be interesting to see how the new features work.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
If you are looking for a solid email platform that is priced well and has very capable automation email features. Getresponse is an excellent choice.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have clients that need email marking but are not using a platform to do so.  Getresponse has been a great choice for many of these folks and has worked quite well.  The biggest benefit is that it has served my customers well and has helped me grow my business

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
GR is an essential tool for managing relations with users.
In our company we generate more than 25k leads a month from 5 different sites. With GR we can interact with users automatically with autoresponders, inform users of a specific list about top news, service updates or new services. We can also measure in real time their interest in our content with open rate rates, click rates and clean lists with contacts no longer interested in our service.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Sometimes, very rarely, GR freeze and the work created is blocked and lost.
Furthermore GR could create a search function of our images and not have to scroll all the stocks.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
The accounts don't speak in Italian and do not use a instant messaging system like Skype o Messenger. Sometimes messaging via email causes delays in replies of up to 12-24 hours.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing 600k users is impossible without a complete tool like GR.
Thanks to Zapier every single data is transferred to the GR via API and with the autoresponders each individual user receives a message for each specific service.

- API has reasonable rate limits, and I like that rate limit info is included in response headers.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
- I find the web interface to be confusing and somewhat hard to use. For example, urls do not always contain all the state needed to get to a particular page, so I can't bookmark or copy/paste links to certain pages/views. Instead, I have to always click through to get to them, or say/write instructions if I'm explaining to someone else how to get there.
- I have seen email addresses get into what looks like a blacklisted state where, after unsubscribing from a campaign, it is not possible to re-subscribe them to the same campaign -- a 400 response comes back from the createContact endpoint. However, the GET blacklist endpoints do not return any items. So the only way I've found to detect if an address is in this state is to attempt to create it and then see if a 400 comes back. Oddly, I can use createContact to subscribe the same email address to a different campaign, and then switch the new contact's campaign to the original one that was returning 400.
- Using single-character tokens for entity ids is unusual in my experience, and can be confusing.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
GetResponse delivers daily emails to our lists with 100K - 1M subscribers, and it seems to work well at that. I appreciate being able to use the API to programmatically subscribe/unsubscribe contacts.

all_reviews.review_title: An easy-to-use newsletter tool with many features but room for improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
It is very easy to use also for beginners. You can just drag pictures, copy templates, add templates and move them around. The tool itself comes with many features and templates that are good for companies that do not have an own graphic department but still want to send out appealing and catchy newsletters. Plus, it is responsive and thus can be properly displayed on any device. The service hotline is also ok and helpful.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The formatting sometimes changes completely when the newsletter is sent out. It might look great in the tool but not good in your e-mail program. It also doesn't always work well with outlook. Since many recipients use outlook this definitely needs to be improved. Most of the formatting problems can only be solved in the HTML code and if you don't have an IT expert at hand, you might be screwed.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were in need of a better newsletter tool that is easy to use, offers different newsletter formats and features a responsive design. GetResponse offers that and is better than our old one but still not perfect.

GetResponse has a high cost, and although this factor does not affect my company because the advertising campaigns give us a good return on financing, I think that prices should be reduced so that many more people have access to this service.

all_reviews.review_title: Why I can not reccomend GetResponse
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I like the webinars and also the 24/7 live chat

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Actually, everything started very well - the support was fine with all minor issues while implementing the system. I tranferred my business to Getresponse. Unfortunately the safety team disabled my account while I was sending my first Newsletter, because my opening rate was to low ( 30 min after I sent an email to about 11.000 addresses).
As they closed my account, all my landing pages, planned webinars weren't reachable for 3 days!!!!!
This is unacceptable for an online business. They opened my account ONLY under the condition, that I agree to let Getresponse delete ALL unopened E-Mail addresses, and I can not use or upload them ever again. So: I after that action I cannot email even my employees or organize a webinar with them. Additionally, they deleted all my pictures and stock photos... but did not inform me about that. They are unable to recover them for more than 3 weeks now and do not answer my ticket. 24/7 support is available, but just can tell me that someone will come back to me somewhen. So, there is no one who has the courage to talk to me by phone. On one hand, they do not deliver there service - on the other hand they want me to pay full amount. It is the worst service I ever got. IF YOU NEED A RELIABLE CONTACT PLATTFORM, DO NOT TOUCH GETRESPONSE!

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
Make sure to have a clear list and do some test emails before you send to a complete newsletter. As I have written, they closed my account and deleted all my data unrecoverable!

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
Acutally none, because Getresponse deleted all my data.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Builder - Where to start with this.
1) Once you create a multi-column block of content it's almost impossible to put anything beneath it
2) The images when placed in there often look very janky and difficult to get aligned properly, especially on mobile.
With so many builders available on the market to experiment with and improve theirs based on - it's pretty low in the market place.

Automatons - these are very difficult to manage - especially if you want to change someone's custom variable based on a form submission and then update them for another on
- Creating a time based resend loop was also a huge undertaking

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
The Gravity Forms integration is difficult to manage. Neither support team wants to help with it, and there are a lot of field options that are not able to be imported via the feed.

Using an embedded form from GetResponse in your Wordpress site throws up SPAM/Malicious Software issues in Google Ads.

Just using it for email - there wasn't a ton (if any) benefits realized.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Email Platform For Our Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I think having the ability to customize email workflows without a ton of backend work has been one of the most helpful parts of GetResponse. Most other email platforms don't make marketing automation as intuitive as you guys do. That was one of the big draws for us when we signed on.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
I feel like the deliverability rates tend to fluctuate a bit more than other platforms we've used in the past. The other element I would recommend revisiting is customizing custom variables. We use custom variables to align our customer product interests. As of right now, we can't add a new product to our interests variable without pausing the entirety of our automation. It's kind of a pain.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
I'd suggest taking a look at the workflow automation tools and reaffirm that the GetResponse system makes sense for your business.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's allowed us to be a bit more proactive in getting in front of customers at the right time. Now we're getting in front of prospects both before and after a purchase has been made with little day-to-day maintenance. GetResponse has saved me, personally, a lot of time on the email component of my workweek.

all_reviews.review_title: Getresponse Provides a feature-rich email-marketing solution.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The new version provides all the funnel, automation, landing pages, and auto responders I could ever need with hundreds of customizable templates.
- Landing pages. - Preview of created emails from different email clients. - Great schedule for autoresponders. - custom fields for collected emails. - a lot more - simply a big marketing machine. - Awesome Affiliate program
GetResponse makes it easy to setup and launch email campaigns and manage subscriber lists and contacts. Lots of templates make it easy for those with limited technical skills.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
There is a fairly steep learning curve. Some support can be a bit 'testy' if you ask basic questions. Others are fantastic.
The work flow automation and integration takes some time to learn. It would be nice to have more tutorials on the feature and how it can be integrated into your marketing.
The mobile app could be better. There i no proper WYSYWIG editor, which is a problem comparing to competition.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
Start now

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
The system helps me to interact with my subscribers effortlessly, I can easily create forms. GR is beneficial platform that allows you to send multiple lists at once. I love the time sending option.
We operate as a non-profit. The people on the list we've made via GR are considered to be our most willing givers. They managed to opt in since they're interested in us. They're likely to provide than those whose e-mails we got via a costly e-mail finding platform.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
The ease of the onboarding process. It took a total of a month and a half to be 100% integrated.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The wysiwyg for templates doesn't snap to align with other conent blocks. You habe tondrag and align visually as best you can. For landing pages their wasn't a way to create HTML only allowing the ability to be dynamic.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
The good.
Easier for anyone to use.
Support was excellent.
The needs improvement.
We hard coded our emails to be able to have dynamic content, but the wysiwyg for templates left a lot to be desired.
Also, the automation was easy, but with easy comes customizable issues as you are required to only be able to use the options given. Most issues I could find work arounds but not everything.
The bad.
They may have fixed it but the limitations of list uploads.
Their landing pages left a lot to be desired. You had to use the wysiwyg and elements didn't snap to align correctly, and I didn't see how to make them dynamic. We just ended up using our main site to also host landing pages.
The webinar platform was buggy. Even when they would host their own webinars they often had screen share and sound issues.

I haven't used GR in nearly a year and I know they were aware of these issues and were also appreciated my insite and seemed to have a willingness to improve.

Overall if you are a small to mid size company and have someone able to code your own emails to be dynamic, GR has a lot to offer.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were usin SFMC legancy systems and content builder. The main reasons for switching was the inclusion of automation and the ability to score leads. The fact that the price point was less, and we could still send dynamic emails (HTML only) was also a plus.

all_reviews.review_title: Looking for Marketo Junior - SMB price?
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I like that I get a drag and drop email, landing page, marketing automation, web form, and mini crm all for a low-end price point.  I've used Marketo and loved it but needed a budget cut.  I tried Campaign Monitor, but it didn't have a landing page tool.  Get Response is perfect for our small business.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The only thing I dislike is that it doesn't allow for full modification of DKIM records.  Marketo and Campaign Monitor allowed me to get rid of the "On behalf of" in the from the section of Outlook emails.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
I recommend you look into GetResponse if you are looking to consolidate your applications and move to an all in one platform.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm able to more quickly and effectively get campaigns up and running and am able to better tie lead generation from the web to the marketing tool and synced back to our CRM.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful and versatile with a clunky interface
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
That's a long list but the most important features are statistics, RSS to email, and marketing automation. The things you can do with marketing automation workflows. My head was about to explode trying to visualize and combine all the possible customer journeys but I managed and GR provided. Great experience.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
The fact that not all functions are properly described (what do they actually do), especilly automation workflow actions and some unclear language assignment rules. For instance, lead's language depends on the language of campaign they are assigned to. But what if they are assigned to several campaigns? If you, GR, are reading this, you could make it clearer if these are separate records or just campaigns are assigned to contact records.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
Use the new UI - it's much better. And when contacting support, use the online chat. You would have to wait a long time if you mailed them. Overall, the experience is OK. But that's just because the tool is so extensive - which makes it harder to learn it but gives you a lot of features. Mind you, it may look like I don't recommend this tool but I wholeheartedly do. It's just it does have some issues.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
The majority of our automated or mass email communication is handled by GetResponse. It took a lot of time to set it up but once it's configured, you do get a lot handled for you. Sure, you need to adjust a thing or two from time to time but that's just improving your communication.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GetResponse MAX?
I use GetResponse for automated campaigns and list building (using Formidable Forms on a Wordpress site). The automation piece is very simple to understand and build. We have played around with the webinar feature, and it is very robust. It is designed specifically for webinars with mostly 1 speaker, and doesn't work well as a conference call type of class. But the very best thing about GetResponse is their instant customer service via chat. I will run into something that I can't figure out how to do, I pop open the chat window, and have my answer in a couple of minutes.

What do you dislike about GetResponse MAX?
Some things in the interface are not very intuitive. Like when I want to create an email as part of my automated campaign, and it's called a "newsletter." But like I said above, the answers are only moments away with their chat support, so I can't complain. One of the things I really don't like is that when you remove a contact from one of your lists, it's gone. There is no "all contacts" repository where you could keep a contact, but without any list memberships.

Recommendations to others considering GetResponse MAX:
This is a great software especially for a company just getting its feet wet with automated marketing campaigns. It's cost effective and pretty simple to use after an initial learning curve. And even for experienced marketers, it offers plenty of features.

What problems is GetResponse MAX solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using GetResponse for automated campaigns, for event registration, and for surveys.
